item.title: MLT Release 1.0.3
item.description:
Mulato Library of Tests

After some time I am back to my roots, the new release of MLT (Mulato Library of Tests) proves that. With an objective of provide a simple C Header file to test your C software with Unit tests and more.

How to use it

There are some steps to add the C Header file and plug into your code

  1. Obviously copy the mlt.h into your src/ or /include folder.
  2. Tweak your Makefile or any of your build system and add -DMLT_TESTING=1 when you be compiling your sample of tests.
  3. Add the #ifndef MLT_TESTING into your before you call the main() function.

Step 1: Copy the C Header file.

git clone https://github.com/mulatinho/mlt.git
cp -pv mlt/mlt.h /workdir/your-code/src/mlt.h

Introducing CurrencyCalc: A Simple Currency Converter

Need a quick and efficient way to convert currencies? Meet CurrencyCalc, a lightweight currency conversion tool designed for ease of use and accuracy.

Why Use CurrencyCalc?

  • Fast and Simple: No unnecessary complexity, just enter your values and get instant conversions.
  • Accessible: Works directly in your browser, no installation required.
  • Lightweight: Designed for efficiency without bloated features.

How to Use It?

  1. Visit CurrencyCalc.
  2. Enter the amount and select the currencies.
